While it has been described as the world's smallest nation,{{cite web |url=http://www.theaustralian.news.com.au/story/0,25197,22726244-5002031,00.html|title=JOURNEYS â THE SPIRIT OF DISCOVERY: Simon Sellars braves wind and waves to visit the unlikely North Sea nation of Sealand|accessdate=10 November 2007 |work=The Australian }} {{Dead link|date=September 2010|bot=H3llBot}} Sealand is not currently officially recognised as a sovereign state by [[list of sovereign states|any sovereign state]]. Although Roy Bates claims it is ''[[de facto]]'' recognised by Germany as they have sent a diplomat to the micronation, and by the United Kingdom after an English court ruled it did not have jurisdiction over Sealand, neither action constitutes ''[[de jure]]'' recognition as far as the respective countries are concerned.[http://www.sealandgov.org/history.html History Of Sealand] The Principality of Sealand ==History== ===History of HM Fort Roughs=== {{Main|HM Fort Roughs}} In 1943, during World War II, HM Fort Roughs was constructed by the United Kingdom as one of the [[Maunsell Forts]],{{cite book|last=Zumerchik|first=John|title=Seas and Waterways of the World: An Encyclopedia of History, Uses, and Issues|year=2008|publisher=ABC-CLIO Ltd|isbn=978-1-85109-711-1|url=http://books.google.com/?id=IBKoUXrF5p0C&pg=PA563&dq=hm+fort+roughs#v=onepage&q=hm%20fort%20roughs&f=false|page=563}} primarily for defence against German mine-laying aircraft that might be targeting the estuaries that were part of vital shipping lanes; It comprised a floating [[Pontoon (boat)|pontoon]] base with a superstructure of two hollow towers joined by a deck upon which other structures could be added. The fort was towed to a position above the [[Rough Sands]] sandbar, where its base was deliberately flooded to allow it to sink to its final resting place on the sandbar. The location chosen was approximately six miles from the coast of [[Suffolk]], outside the then [[three-mile limit|three-mile territorial water]] claim of the United Kingdom and therefore in [[international waters]]. The facility (called Roughs Tower or HM Fort Roughs) was occupied by 150â300 [[Royal Navy]] personnel throughout World War II;{{cite web |url=http://www.project-redsand.com/history.htm |title=Project Redsand information on offshore defences |accessdate=13 November 2007 |publisher=Project Redsand}}{{Verify credibility|date=November 2007}} not until well after the war, in 1956, were the last full-time personnel taken off HM Fort Roughs. ===Occupation by Roy Bates and the establishment of Sealand=== [[Image:Royal Standard of the Prince of Sealand.svg|left|thumb|Royal Standard of the Prince of Sealand.]] On 2 September 1967, the fort was occupied by Major [[Paddy Roy Bates]], a British subject and [[pirate radio]] broadcaster, who ejected a competing group of pirate broadcasters.{{cite book|title=Micronations|author=John Ryan, George Dunford & Simon Sellars|publisher=[[Lonely Planet]]|year=2006|isbn=1-74104-730-7|page=9}} Bates intended to broadcast his pirate radio station [[Radio Essex (pirate radio station)|Radio Essex]] from the platform.{{Cite news | last = Gould | first = Jack | author-link = | publication-date = | date = 24 March 1966 | year = | title = Radio: British Commercial Broadcasters Are at Sea; Illegal Programs Are Beamed From Ships | periodical = New York Times | series = | publication-place = | place = | publisher= | volume = | issue = | pages = | url = | issn = | doi = | oclc = | accessdate = 18 October 2008 | postscript = }} In 1968, British workmen entered what Bates claimed to be his territorial waters in order to service a navigational buoy near the platform. Michael Bates (son of Paddy Roy Bates) tried to scare the workmen off by firing warning shots from the former fort. As Bates was a [[British subject]] at the time, he was summoned to court in England on firearms charges following the incident.{{cite news |title=Welcome to Sealand. Now Bugger Off |url=http://www.wired.com/wired/archive/8.07/haven.html|publisher=[[Wired News]] |date=July 2000|accessdate=11 November 2007}} But the court ruled that as the platform (which Bates was now calling "Sealand") was outside British jurisdiction, being beyond the then three-mile limit of the country's waters,''Regina v. Paddy Roy Bates and Michael Roy Bates'', The Shire Hall, Chelmsford, 25 October 1968. {{cite web |url=http://www.seanhastings.com/havenco/sealand/judgement.html |title=Regina v. Paddy Roy Bates and Michael Roy Bates|accessdate=11 November 2007|publisher=The Shire Hall, Chelmsford |work=}} the case could not proceed. In 1975, Bates introduced a constitution for Sealand, followed by a flag, a national anthem, a currency and passports.{{cite web|url=http://www.sealandgov.org/history.html |title=The Principality of Sealand |publisher=Sealandgov.org |date= |accessdate=2011-11-21}} In August 1978, while Bates and his wife were in England, [[Alexander Achenbach]], who describes himself as the Prime Minister of Sealand, hired several German and Dutch mercenaries to spearhead an attack of Roughs Tower.{{cite book | title = Micronations | author=John Ryan, George Dunford & Simon Sellars | publisher=[[Lonely Planet]] | year = 2006 | isbn=1-74104-730-7 | page = 11}} They stormed the tower with [[speedboats]] and [[helicopters]], and took Bates' son hostage. Bates was able to retake the tower and capture Achenbach and the mercenaries. Achenbach, a German lawyer who held a Sealand passport, was charged with [[treason]] against Sealand and was held unless he paid [[German mark|DM]] 75,000 (more than US$ 35,000 or Â£23,000).{{cite news|title=Attempt to free captive from private 'island' fails|date=5 September 1978|page=3|publisher=The Times}} The governments of the Netherlands, Austria and Germany petitioned the British government for his release, but the United Kingdom disavowed his imprisonment, citing the 1968 court decision. Germany then sent a diplomat from its London embassy to Roughs Tower to negotiate for Achenbach's release. Roy Bates relented after several weeks of negotiations and subsequently claimed that the diplomat's visit constituted ''[[de facto]]'' recognition of Sealand by Germany. Following his repatriation, Achenbach and Gernot PÃ¼tz established a "[[government in exile]]", sometimes known as the Sealand Rebel Government, or Sealandic Rebel Government, in Germany, Aschenbach's appointed successor, Johannes Seiger, continues to claim via his website that he is Sealand's legitimate ruling authority.{{cite web |url=http://principality-of-sealand.eu/welcome_e.html |title=Homepage of Sealandic Government in Exile |accessdate=13 November 2007 |publisher=Sealandic Government in Exile}} ===Post-1990 history=== [[Image:Sealandafterfire2.JPG|thumb|Sealand several months after the fire]] *1997: Because of the massive number of illegal passports in circulation (estimated at 150,000), the Bates family revoked all Sealand passports, including those that they themselves had issued over the previous twenty-two years. *2006: On the afternoon of 23 June 2006, the top platform of the Roughs Tower caught fire due to an electrical failure. A [[Royal Air Force]] rescue helicopter transferred one person to Ipswich hospital, directly from the tower. The [[Harwich]] [[lifeboat (rescue)|lifeboat]] stood by the Roughs Tower until a local fire tug extinguished the fire.{{cite web |url=http://www.bobleroi.co.uk/ScrapBook/Sealand_Fire/Sealand_Fire.html |title=Sealand on Fire |accessdate=25 June 2006 |author=Bob Le-Roi}} All damage was repaired by November 2006.{{cite web |url=http://www.churchandeast.co.uk.nyud.net/Sealand%20update%204.html |title=Church and East renovation completion |accessdate=2006 |publisher=Church and East |work=}} * In January 2007, [[The Pirate Bay]] attempted to buy Sealand after harsher [[copyright]] measures in Sweden forced them to look for a base of operations elsewhere.{{cite news|last=Graham |first=Flora |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/technology/7893223.stm |title=Technology | How The Pirate Bay sailed into infamy |publisher=BBC News |date=16 February 2009 |accessdate=9 April 2009}} The deal fell through. *2007 - 2010: Sealand was offered for sale through Spanish estate company InmoNaranja.{{cite news |title=Tiny North Sea tax haven for sale |url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/newsitems/200701/s1823039.htm |publisher=[[ABC News]] |id= |pages= |page= |date=8 January 2007 |accessdate=8 January 2007}} Since a principality cannot technically be sold, Sealand's current owners plan to transfer "custodianship".{{cite news |title=News story on Sealand transfer |url=http://www.news.com.au/story/0,23599,21026372-1702,00.html|publisher=News.com.au|date=8 January 2007 |accessdate=8 January 2007}} {{Dead link|date=August 2010|bot=RjwilmsiBot}} The asking price is [[Euro|â¬]]750 million ([[GBP|Â£]]600 million).{{cite news|title='Smallest state' seeks new owners |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/6239967.stm| publisher=BBC|date=8 January 2007 |accessdate=8 January 2007}}{{cite news|title=Evening Star |url=http://www.eveningstar.co.uk/content/eveningstar/news/story.aspx?brand=ESTOnline&category=News&tBrand=ESTOnline&tCategory=News&itemid=IPED06%20Jan%202007%2006%3A41%3A18%3A723 |publisher=Evening Star|date=6 January 2007 |accessdate=6 January 2007}}{{cite news|title=For sale, World's smallest country |url=http://www.smh.com.au/news/world/for-sale-worlds-smallest-country/2007/01/08/1168104905597.html |publisher=The [[Sydney Morning Herald]] |date=8 January 2007 |accessdate=8 January 2007}} *2012: Sealand online Casino is expected to be opened by late 2012 (see [[#Economy]]).{{cite web|url=http://www.sealandcasino.com/ |title=Official home of the online |publisher=Sealand Casino |date= |accessdate=2011-11-21}} ==Popular culture== ===Film=== It has been reported that a film about Sealand is in production. It was originally pencilled-in for release in 2008,{{cite web|last=Hansen |first=Burke |url=http://www.theregister.co.uk/2007/09/23/sealand_satellite_movie/ |title=Sealand seeks satellite and movie deals |publisher=Theregister.co.uk |date=23 September 2007 |accessdate=9 April 2009}} but has yet to be released. Sean Sorensen has been named as the writer, and [[Mike Newell (director)|Mike Newell]] as director.{{cite web|url=http://www.sealandnews.com/category/sealand-the-movie/ |title=Sealand News |publisher=Sealand News |date= |accessdate=9 April 2009}} Michael Bates has verified this claim in an interview on YouTube. An [[Cinema of Austria|Austrian]] [[documentary]] film called ''[[Empire Me]]'' focuses on the [[micronation]] movement and covers Sealand. The film has been pushed back to at least 2012, according to recent interview on [[YouTube]].{{citation needed|date=November 2011}} The film "Hetalia: Paint it White" features Sealand as a minor character with a functioning sea fortress, stating that if it "helps the other countries, maybe they'll accept Sealand as a real country." Sealand also appears at the end of the movie, no longer a "noppera". ===In music=== [[The Battle of Sealand]] is the first studio album from the American [[shoegaze]] band [[Airiel]]. It was released in August 2007 on Chicago-based Highwheel Records. The album is named after the Principality of Sealand. Tragic!]], produced by [[Pixies]] frontman [[Frank Black]].{{cite web | url=http://www.sentimentalistmag.com/2011/03/14/art-brut-release-fourth-album-brilliant-tragic-on-may-24th/ | title=Art Brut Release Fourth Album! Brilliant! Tragic! | accessdate=2011-03-15}} ===Comics and animation=== In the [[manga]] and [[anime]] series ''[[Hetalia: Axis Powers]]'' by Hidekaz Himaruya, which features [[stereotype]]d [[moe anthropomorphism|anthropomorphic]] personifications of countries and empires, Sealand is a character. Sealand is described as the smallest character in the series, a reference to the fact it is, "The smallest (unofficial) nation in the world". He is depicted as having short blond hair and wearing a blue and white sailor suit. His obscurity reaches far beyond the grasp of the real Sealand.{{Cite comic|writer=Himaruya, Hidekaz|title=[[Hetalia: Axis Powers]]|volume=2|date=10 December 2008|publisher=[[Tokyopop]]|page=24}} ==Government and politics== ===Legal status=== The claim that Sealand is an independent sovereign state is based on the contention that a 1968 decision of an English court, in which it was held that Roughs Tower was in international waters and thus outside the jurisdiction of the domestic courts.{{cite web | url=http://www.sealandgov.org/history.html | title=Official History of Sealand | accessdate = 12 January 2007|publisher=Government of Principality of Sealand}} {{Infobox Political post | post = Prince | body = Sealand | nativename = |insignia = Sealand Coat of Arms.svg | insigniasize = 120px | insigniacaption = Coat of arms | department = | image = | alt = | incumbent = [[Roy Bates, Prince of Sealand|Roy Bates]] as [[Prince]]
Michael Bates as [[Prince Regent]] | incumbentsince = | style = [[Royal Highness|His Royal Highness]] | residence = [[HM Fort Roughs|Fort Roughs]], Sealand | nominator = | nominatorpost = | appointer = | appointerpost = | termlength = | inaugural = | formation = 22 September 1967 | last = | abolished = | succession = | deputy = | salary = | website = [http://www.sealandgov.org/ SealandGov.org] }} [[Image:Map of Sealand with territorial waters.svg|thumb|250px|Map of Sealand and the United Kingdom, with territorial water claims of 3 [[Nautical mile|NM]] and 12 NM shown.]] [[Image:Sealand-sky.jpg|thumb|250px|Sealand from above]] In [[international law]], the two most common schools of thought for the creation of statehood are the [[constitutive theory of statehood|constitutive]] and [[declarative theory of statehood|declaratory]] theories of state creation. The constitutive theory was the standard nineteenth-century model of statehood, and the declaratory theory was developed in the twentieth century to address shortcomings of the constitutive theory. In the constitutive theory, a state exists exclusively via recognition by other states. The theory splits on whether this recognition requires "diplomatic recognition" or merely "recognition of existence". No other state grants Sealand official recognition, but it has been argued by Bates that negotiations carried out by Germany constituted "recognition of existence". In the declaratory theory of statehood, an entity becomes a state as soon as it meets the minimal criteria for statehood. Therefore recognition by other states is purely "declaratory".{{cite book | last=Ryan | first=John | coauthors=George Dunford, Simon Sellars | title=Micronations, The Lonely Planet Guide to Home-Made Nations | publisher=[[Lonely Planet]] | year=2006 | pages=5â6 | isbn=1-74104-730-7}} In 1987, the UK extended its territorial waters from three to twelve miles. Sealand now sits inside waters that Britain claims as its territory.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk/778267.stm |title=Offshore and offline? |publisher=BBC News |date=5 June 2000 |accessdate=9 April 2009}} ===As a statelike entity=== Irrespective of its legal status, Sealand is managed by the Bates family as if it were a recognised sovereign entity, and they are its hereditary [[royal family|royal]] rulers. Roy Bates styles himself "Prince Roy" and his wife "Princess Joan". Their son is known as "[[Royal Highness|His Royal Highness]] Prince Michael" and has been referred to as the "[[Prince Regent]]" by the Bates family since 1999.{{cite web |url=http://www.sealandnews.com/the-royal-family/ |title=Information on Sealand's royal family |accessdate=13 November 2007 |publisher=Sealand News}} In this role, he apparently serves as Sealand's acting "Head of State" and also its "Head of Government".{{cite book|title=Micronations|author=John Ryan, George Dunford & Simon Sellars|publisher=[[Lonely Planet]]|year=2006|isbn=1-74104-730-7|page=8}} At a micronations conference hosted by the [[University of Sunderland]] in 2004, Sealand was represented by Michael Bates' son James, who was referred to as "Prince Royal James."{{cite web | url=http://www.sealandnews.com/the-royal-family/ | title=Information on Sealand's royal family| accessdate=11 November 2007 |publisher=Government of Principality of Sealand}} The facility is now occupied by one or more caretakers representing Michael Bates, who himself resides in [[Essex]], England. On 10 February 2007, Matthew Thompson was appointed an honorary president of Sealand. Sealand's constitution was instituted in 1974. It consists of a [[preamble]] and seven articles. The preamble asserts Sealand's independence, while the articles variously deal with Sealand's status as a [[constitutional monarchy]], the empowerment of government bureaus, the role of an appointed, advisory [[senate]], the functions of an appointed, advisory legal [[tribunal]], a proscription against the [[Right to keep and bear arms|bearing of arms]] except by members of a designated "Sealand Guard", the exclusive right of the sovereign to formulate [[foreign policy]] and alter the constitution, and the hereditary [[patrilinear]] succession of the monarchy.{{cite web |url=http://www.muu.fi/amorph03/downloads/pdfs/principality_of_sealand.pdf |title=Information on the Principality of Sealand including constitution |accessdate=9 November 2007 |publisher=Amorph Summit of Micronations |format=PDF}} Sealand's [[legal system]] is claimed to follow British [[common law]], and [[statute]]s take the form of [[decree]]s enacted by the sovereign.{{cite web |url=http://www.sealandgov.com/notices.html |title=The Principality of Sealand statutory notices |accessdate=27 July 2006|publisher=Government of the Principality of Sealand |work=}} Sealand has issued [[passport]]s and has operated as a [[flag of convenience]] state, and it also holds the Guinness World Record for "the smallest area to lay claim to nation status".{{cite book | title=Guinness World Records 2008 | publisher=Guinness World Records | year=2007 | page=131 | isbn=978-1-904994-18-3}} Sealand's [[motto]] is ''E Mare Libertas'' ({{lang-en|From the Sea, Freedom}}).Note that this is not "normal" Latin; "mari" would be more correct. It appears on Sealandic items, such as stamps, passports, and coins, and is the title of the Sealandic anthem. The anthem was composed by Londoner Basil Simonenko;{{cite web |url=http://david.national-anthems.net/sea.htm |title=Sealandic National Anthem |accessdate=15 November 2007 |publisher=Nationalanthems.info}} it does not have lyrics. ==Economy== Sealand has been involved in several commercial operations, including the issuing of coins and postage stamps and the establishment of an offshore Internet hosting facility, or "data haven". Sealand also has an official website and publishes an online newspaper, ''Sealand News''.{{cite web |url=http://www.sealandnews.com |title=Sealand News |accessdate=11 November 2007 |publisher=Sealand News |work=}} In addition, a number of amateur athletes "represent" Sealand in sporting events, including unconventional events like the egg throwing world championship, which the Sealand team won in 2008.{{cite news |title=Sealand News report on Egg Throwing Championship |url=http://www.sealandnews.com/sealand-wins-sporting-accolade_207.html|publisher=Sealand News |date=30 October 2008 |accessdate=30 October 2008}} According to ''Sealand News'',{{cite news|title=Sealand News report on Sealand (2008 film) |url=http://www.sealandnews.com/sealand-the-movie_15.html|publisher=Sealand News|date=28 February 2007 |accessdate=28 February 2007}} a movie called ''Sealand'' is in development for release in 2012.{{cite web |url=http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1223973/ |title=Overview on Sealand (2008 film)|accessdate=1 July 2007| publisher=The Internet Movie Database |work=}} As of 11 February 2007, Sealand is also taking bookings for tourist visits.{{cite web |url=http://www.churchandeast.com/tourism.htm |title= Sealand tourist visits press release |accessdate=23 June 2007 |work=}} For a period, Sealand [[camouflage passport]]s were mass-manufactured and sold widely by a Spanish-based group believed{{Who|date=January 2009}} to be associated with the "exile government" under Seiger. These passports, which the Bates family say were not authorized by them, were linked to several high-profile crimes. All passports were revoked by Roy Bates in 1997. There was a 2007 [[census]], which was published in early 2008 that can be found here [http://www.muu.fi/amorph03/downloads/pdfs/principality_of_sealand.pdf]. After [[HavenCo]] unexpected collapse, Sealand's government is in the process of building a new online casino. scotland |publisher=Privateislandsonline.com |date= |accessdate=2011-11-21}} ===Coins and stamps=== {{Main|Coins and postage stamps of Sealand}} [[Image:Sealand Coins Flag.jpg|250px|thumb|Sealandic coins, from left to right: Half Dollar, Silver One Dollar and Quarter Dollar]] Several dozen different Sealand coins have been minted since 1972. In the early 1990s, Achenbach's German group also produced a coin, featuring a likeness of "Prime Minister Seiger".{{cite web |url=http://www.imperial-collection.net/sealand03.html |title=The Imperial Collection â Principality of Sealand|publisher=Empire of Atlantium |accessdate=11 November 2007 |work=}} Sealand's coins and postage stamps are denominated in "Sealand dollars", which it deems to be at [[purchasing power parity|parity]] with the U.S. dollar.{{cite web |url=http://www.sealandgov.org/About.html |title=Principality of Sealand|publisher=Government of the Principality of Sealand |accessdate=17 July 2008 |work=}} Sealand first issued [[postage stamp]]s in 1969, and issues through 1977. No further stamps were produced until 2010. Sealand is not a member of the [[Universal Postal Union]], therefore its inward address is a [[PO Box]] in the United Kingdom.{{cite web |url=http://www.royalmail.com/portal/rm/addressfinder;jsessionid=I1BCVKJXHDFL0FB2IGEUQEQUHRAYOQ2K?catId=400145&pageId=pcaf_a_one_result_rm&_requestid=116508&gear=postcode |title=Royal Mail address for Sealand|publisher=Royal Mail |accessdate=10 November 2007 |work=}} Once it is mailed to Sealand's tourist and government office it will then be brought to Sealand, Sealand only has one street address ''The Row''.[http://www.sealandgov.org/notices/pn03710.html/ ]{{dead link|date=November 2011}} A Sealand mailing address looks like this Bureau of Internal Affairs 5, The Row SEALAND 1001 (c/o Sealand Post Bag, IP11 9SZ, UK) ===Sealand noble titles=== In recent years the Principality of Sealand has been selling the titles of Lord, Lady, Baron and Baroness through its website at [http://www.sealandgov.org/ sealandgov.org]. ===HavenCo=== {{Main|HavenCo}} In 2000, worldwide publicity was created about Sealand following the establishment of a new entity called [[HavenCo]], a [[data haven]], which effectively took control of Roughs Tower itself; however, [[Ryan Lackey]], HavenCo's founder, later quit and claimed that Bates had lied to him by keeping the 1990â1991 court case{{citation needed|date=December 2010}} from him and that, as a result, he had lost the money he had invested in the venture.{{Citation needed|date=November 2008}} In November 2008, operations of HavenCo ceased without explanation.[http://securityandthe.net/2008/11/18/havenco-data-center-offline/ HavenCo âdata centerâ offline?], Security and the Net, 18 November 2008 ==Sports== Sealand has official national [[sportsperson|athletes]], including non-Sealanders. These athletes take part in various sports, such as [[Miniature golf|mini-golf]], [[Association football|football]], [[fencing]], and [[Subbuteo|table football]], although Sealand's fencing team competes out of the country.{{cite web |url=http://www.sealandfootball.dk/index.asp |title=Homepage of the Sealand National Football Team |accessdate=9 November 2007|publisher=Sealand National Football Team |language=Danish |work=}} Sealand is a provisional member of the [[Nouvelle FÃ©dÃ©ration-Board]], a football sanctioning body for non-recognised states and states not members of [[FIFA]]. Sealand claims that its first official athlete was Darren Blackburn of [[Oakville, Ontario]], Canada, who was appointed in 2003. Blackburn has represented Sealand at a number of local sporting events, including [[Marathon (sport)|marathons]] and off-trail races.{{cite web |url=http://www.sealandgov.org/notices/pn02504.html |title=Principality Notice PN 025/04: International Sporting Activities update. |accessdate=15 November 2007 |publisher=Government of the Principality of Sealand}}Sealand's official U-20 National Football team is coached by American high school soccer coach Rory Miller and is mostly composed of players from his current and recent past roster at [[Muhlenberg North High School]] in [[Greenville, Kentucky]]. In 2004, [[Mountaineering|mountaineer]] Slader Oviatt carried the Sealandic flag to the top of [[Muztagh Ata]].{{cite web |url=http://www.assembly.ab.ca/Documents/isysquery/2fb288a0-1492-468a-876a-113e99b18661/1/doc/ |title=Legislative Assembly of Alberta|publisher=Official Hansard transcripts 24 November 2009, Tuesday evening}} Since 16 December 2007, the [[Yorkshire]]-based [[airsoft]] team SART (Sheffield Armed Response Team){{cite web |url=http://wiki.airsoftcommunity.co.uk/Sart |title=Sheffield Armed Response Team (SART) |accessdate=17 July 2008 |publisher=SART}} represents the Principality at airsoft games as its national team. Also in 2007, Michael Martelle represented the Principality of Sealand in the World Cup of Kung Fu, held in [[Quebec City]], Canada; bearing the designation of ''Athleta Principalitas Bellatorius'' (Principal Martial Arts Athlete and Champion), Martelle won two silver medals, becoming the first-ever Sealand athlete to appear on a world championship podium.{{cite web |url=http://www.lechinois.ca/agenda/programme%20souvenir2007.pdf |title=Program Souvenir Legal |accessdate=17 July 2008 |format=PDF |archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20080627061925/http://www.lechinois.ca/agenda/programme+souvenir2007.pdf |archivedate = 27 June 2008}} Sealand is also represented at the [[Destination ImagiNation]] Global Finals by the team from [[Dobbs Ferry High School]] in [[Dobbs Ferry, New York]]. The team members carried the Sealand flag in the 2007 DI Global Finals Opening Ceremony and plan to do so again at the 2008 event.http://d2k7.globalfinals.org/docs/Dinewssat07.pdf In 2008, Sealand hosted a skateboarding event with Church and East Ltd sponsored by [[Red Bull GmbH|Red Bull]].{{cite web|publisher=Red Bull|url=http://www.redbullskateboarding.com/articles/2008/10/red-bull-access-all-areas-meet.php |title=http://www.redbullskateboarding.com/articles/2008/10/red-bull-access-all-areas-meet.php |publisher=Redbullskateboarding.com |date=15 October 2008 |accessdate=9 April 2009}}{{cite web |url=http://www.lifepr.de/pressemeldungen/red-bull-deutschland-gmbh/boxid-65339.html |title=Skateboarder erobern Seefestung vor der englischen KÃ¼ste|accessdate=29 September 2008}}{{cite web|url=http://www.churchandeast.co.uk/sealand.htm |title=Welcome to Church and East|accessdate=29 September 2008}} Sealand's fencing team is located in the United States, affiliated with the [[University of California, Irvine]]. In 2009, [[Sealand]] announced the formation of a [[Football Association]] and their intention to compete in a future [[Viva World Cup]]. [[Scottish people|Scottish]] [[author]] [[Neil Forsyth]] was appointed as inaugural President of the [[Sealand]] [[Football Association]].{{cite web|url=http://www.prlog.org/10463176-principality-of-sealand-to-have-national-football-team.html |title=Principality of Sealand to have National Football Team |publisher=PR Log |date=23 December 2009 |accessdate=6 December 2010}} Sealand has also gained a representation in the [[Muggle Quidditch]] world, as on December 2nd, 2011 Prince Michael agreed to have the [[RIT]] Quidditch team, known as the "Dark Marks" represent Sealand in [[International Quidditch Association]] events. == See also == {{Portal|Micronations}} * [[Data haven]] * [[Private island]] * [[Ocean colonization]] == References == {{reflist|colwidth=30em}} == Further reading == * Garfinkel, Simson.
